verses.verse: My soul <S%H5315><s%> is weary <S%H5354><s%> of my life <S%H2416><s%>; I will give free course <S%H5800><s%> to my complaint <S%H7879><s%>; I will speak <S%H1696><s%> in the bitterness <S%H4751><s%> of my soul <S%H5315><s%>.
I will say <S%H559><s%> unto God <S%H433><s%>, Do not condemn <S%H7561><s%> me <S%H3045><s%>; Show me wherefore thou contendest with me <S%H7378><s%>.

Is it good <S%H2895><s%> unto thee that thou shouldest oppress <S%H6231><s%>, That thou shouldest despise <S%H3988><s%> the work <S%H3018><s%> of thy hands <S%H3709><s%>, And shine <S%H3313><s%> upon the counsel <S%H6098><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%>?
Hast thou eyes <S%H5869><s%> of flesh <S%H1320><s%>? Or seest <S%H7200><s%> thou as man <S%H582><s%> seeth <S%H7200><s%>?
Are thy days <S%H3117><s%> as the days <S%H3117><s%> of man <S%H582><s%>, Or thy years <S%H8141><s%> as man <S%H1397><s%>'s days <S%H3117><s%>,
That thou inquirest <S%H1245><s%> after mine iniquity <S%H5771><s%>, And searchest <S%H1875><s%> after my sin <S%H2403><s%>,
Although thou knowest <S%H1847><s%> that I am not wicked <S%H7561><s%>, And there is none that can deliver <S%H5337><s%> out of thy hand <S%H3027><s%>?
Thy hands <S%H3027><s%> have framed <S%H6087><s%> me and fashioned <S%H6213><s%> me Together <S%H3162><s%> round about <S%H5439><s%>; yet thou dost destroy me <S%H1104><s%>.
Remember <S%H2142><s%>, I beseech thee <S%H6213><s%>, that thou hast fashioned me as clay <S%H2563><s%>; And wilt thou bring <S%H7725><s%> me into dust <S%H6083><s%> again <S%H7725><s%>?
Hast thou not poured me out <S%H5413><s%> as milk <S%H2461><s%>, And curdled <S%H7087><s%> me like cheese <S%H1385><s%>?
Thou hast clothed <S%H3847><s%> me with skin <S%H5785><s%> and flesh <S%H1320><s%>, And knit <S%H7753><s%> me together with bones <S%H6106><s%> and sinews <S%H1517><s%>.
Thou hast granted <S%H6213><s%> me life <S%H2416><s%> and lovingkindness <S%H2617><s%>; And thy visitation <S%H6486><s%> hath preserved <S%H8104><s%> my spirit <S%H7307><s%>.
Yet these things thou didst hide <S%H6845><s%> in thy heart <S%H3824><s%>; I know that this is with thee <S%H3045><s%>:
If I sin <S%H2398><s%>, then thou markest <S%H8104><s%> me <S%H5352><s%>, And thou wilt not acquit me from mine iniquity <S%H5771><s%>.

If I be wicked <S%H7561><s%>, woe <S%H480><s%> unto me <S%H6663><s%>; And if I be righteous, yet shall I not lift up <S%H5375><s%> my head <S%H7218><s%>; Being filled <S%H7649><s%> with ignominy <S%H7036><s%>, And looking <S%H7202><s%> upon mine affliction <S%H6040><s%>.
And if my head exalt <S%H1342><s%> itself <S%H6679><s%>, thou huntest me as a lion <S%H7826><s%>; And again <S%H7725><s%> thou showest thyself marvellous upon me <S%H6381><s%>.

Thou renewest <S%H2318><s%> thy witnesses <S%H5707><s%> against me <S%H7235><s%>, And increasest thine indignation <S%H3708><s%> upon me <S%H5978><s%>: Changes <S%H2487><s%> and warfare are with me <S%H6635><s%>.
Wherefore then hast thou brought me forth <S%H3318><s%> out of the womb <S%H7358><s%>? I had given up the ghost <S%H1478><s%>, and no eye <S%H5869><s%> had seen me <S%H7200><s%>.
I should have been as though I had not been <S%H2986><s%>; I should have been carried from the womb <S%H990><s%> to the grave <S%H6913><s%>.
Are not my days <S%H3117><s%> few <S%H4592><s%>? cease <S%H2308><s%> then <S%H7896><s%>, And let me alone, that I may take comfort <S%H1082><s%> a little <S%H4592><s%>,
Before I go <S%H3212><s%> whence I shall not return <S%H7725><s%>, Even to the land <S%H776><s%> of darkness <S%H2822><s%> and of the shadow of death <S%H6757><s%>;

The land <S%H776><s%> dark <S%H5890><s%> as midnight <S%H652><s%>, The land of the shadow of death <S%H6757><s%>, without any order <S%H5468><s%>, And where the light <S%H3313><s%> is as midnight <S%H652><s%>.
